alert.note: Alert for Baldwin (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued June 16 at 7:09AM CDT until June 16 at 10:15AM CDT by NWS Mobile
info.description: The National Weather Service in Mobile has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Southeastern Baldwin County in southwestern Alabama... South Central Escambia County in northwestern Florida... Southern Santa Rosa County in northwestern Florida... * Until 1015 AM CDT. * At 709 AM CDT, Local emergency management has reported significant flooding from overnight rainfall across the warned area. Between 6 and 12 inches of rain with local areas up to 16 inches have fallen overnight. New thunderstorms moving into the area will produce additional rainfall amounts of 2 to 5 inches in the warned area. Flash flooding is already occurring and will be renewed with the additional heavy rainfall. HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Law enforcement reported significant flooding already from overnight excessive rainfall. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Pensacola, Ferry Pass, Brent, West Pensacola, Ensley, Warrington, Gonzalez, Foley, Gulf Breeze, Orange Beach, Goulding, Robertsdale, Loxley, Lillian, Myrtle Grove, Magnolia Springs, Oriole Beach, Navarre, Summerdale and Silverhill. FLASH FLOOD...OBSERVED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
